meanings.definition: Of or relating to a subphylum.
meanings.sent1: The subphylar classification helped scientists understand the different groups of animals.
meanings.sent2: The subphylar characteristics of the species were studied in detail.
meanings.sent3: The subphylar differences between the two frog species were quite fascinating.
meanings.sent4: Her subphylar knowledge of marine life was as deep as the ocean itself.
meanings.sent5: The subphylar features of the plant were unique and intriguing.

meanings.definition: Below the level of a phylum.
meanings.sent1: The subphylar organisms were smaller in size compared to those in the phylum.
meanings.sent2: The subphylar category included various species with distinct characteristics.
meanings.sent3: The subphylar creatures lived in harmony beneath the larger phylum members.
meanings.sent4: His subphylar status in the ecosystem was akin to a hidden gem.
meanings.sent5: The subphylar world was a mysterious realm waiting to be explored.
